link:labelLink.link:label: 1: Was capital provided to connections by the authorized institution in the reporting year or did the authorized institution act as guarantor for connections in the reporting year (Article 21a paragraph 2 of the Housing Act)?
2: Did the authorized institution enter into transactions with financial institutions in the reporting year for the performance of its activities (Article 21c paragraph 1 of the Housing Act)?

3: Were decisions taken during the year under review, as referred to in Article 27, paragraph 1a, of the Housing Act that must be submitted to the Minister for approval in advance? With regard to immovable property, this concerns the alienation to third parties of residential accommodation, social real estate and intramural care complexes.
4: Did the approved institution sell homes for its own use in the reporting year (see Article 22 of the BTIV; further elaborated in Articles 9, 10, 11 and 12a of the RTIV)?
5: Has the permitted institution started activities in the reporting period that are part of the non-DAEB activities and for which does it require prior permission from the Minister?
5: In the reporting year, did you enter into legal obligations to have social real estate built, or did you make provisions for social real estate?
6: Has the authorized institution concluded new derivative transactions in the reporting year?
7: Has the authorized institution concluded new investment transactions in the reporting year?
8: Does the authorized institution have investments as referred to in the investment regulations on 31 December of the reporting year?
9: Were new agreements concluded with third parties for the rental of residences of the approved institution (Article 58 BTIV) during the year under review?
10: Were there any disposals of shares in subsidiaries entered into by the authorized institution in the reporting year (Article 27 paragraph 1 sub b of the Housing Act)?
11: Did the approved institution provide peer loans in the reporting year?
12: Has the permitted institution performed activities as referred to in Article 45a of the Housing Act in the reporting year?
13: Has the permitted institution limited itself in the reporting year to the provision of financial resources in the form of the aforementioned in the BTIV (Article 48, paragraph 1)?
15: Did the Admitted Institution carry out liveability activities in the year under review?

If so; Have all these disposals by the authorized institution been approved in advance by the Minister (in this case the Housing Association Authority) in the reporting year?
If so; On 31 December of the reporting year, these investments met the minimum rating requirements in accordance with Article 13 BTIV and Article 41 paragraph 1 sub e of the RTIV.
If so; did the transactions with the financial institutions met the set criteria laid down in Article 13 of the Btiv and Article 3 of the Rtiv?
If so; did these collegiate loans meet the requirements in Article 40a of the RTIV?
If so; does these agreements provide that the authorized institution has access to the rental records in such a way that the correctness and completeness of the housing allocation can be established?
If so; has the Minister (in this case the Housing Association Authority) granted a prior exemption for this activity?
If so; has the authorized institution complied with all the provisions of the RTIV for these sales (see Articles 9, 10, 11 and 12a)?
If so; has the permitted institution obtained permission from the minister (in this case the Housing Associations Authority)?
If so; has this been approved in advance by the minister (in this case the Housing Associations Authority)?
If so; have the regulations on derivatives been complied with by authorized public housing institutions when concluding new derivatives transactions in the year under review?
If so; have the regulations on investment by authorized public housing institutions been complied with when concluding new investment transactions in the reporting year?
If so; have these decisions been submitted to the Minister (in this case the Housing Association Authority) for approval in advance (with a positive result)?
If so; have you put out to tender the contract in question multiple times (with at least 2 parties)?
